5.16: 'Then that Sheshbazzar came [and] laid the foundations of the house of God in Jerusalem; and from then until now it has been under construction and it is not [yet] completed.'
5.3: At that time Tattenai, the governor of [the province] beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai and their colleagues came to them and spoke to them thus, 'Who issued you a decree to rebuild this temple and to finish this structure?'
5.5: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, and they did not stop them until a report could come to Darius, and then a written reply be returned concerning it.
5.12: 'But because our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, [who] destroyed this temple and deported the people to Babylon.
5.10: 'We also asked them their names so as to inform you, and that we might write down the names of the men who were at their head.
5.2: then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and Jeshua the son of Jozadak arose and began to rebuild the house of God which is in Jerusalem; and the prophets of God were with them supporting them.
5.8: 'Let it be known to the king that we have gone to the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is being built with huge stones, and beams are being laid in the walls; and this work is going on with great care and is succeeding in their hands.
5.17: 'Now if it pleases the king, let a search be conducted in the king's treasure house, which is there in Babylon, if it be that a decree was issued by King Cyrus to rebuild this house of God at Jerusalem; and let the king send to us his decision concerning this [matter].'
5.11: 'Thus they answered us, saying, 'We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth and are rebuilding the temple that was built many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and finished.
5.1: When the prophets, Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, who was over them,
5.9: 'Then we asked those elders and said to them thus, 'Who issued you a decree to rebuild this temple and to finish this structure?'
5.14: 'Also the gold and silver utensils of the house of God which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from the temple in Jerusalem, and brought them to the temple of Babylon, these King Cyrus took from the temple of Babylon and they were given to one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had appointed governor.
5.7: They sent a report to him in which it was written thus: 'To Darius the king, all peace.
5.15: 'He said to him, 'Take these utensils, go [and] deposit them in the temple in Jerusalem and let the house of God be rebuilt in its place.'
5.6: [This is] the copy of the letter which Tattenai, the governor of [the province] beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai and his colleagues the officials, who were beyond the River, sent to Darius the king.
5.4: Then we told them accordingly what the names of the men were who were reconstructing this building.
5.13: 'However, in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, King Cyrus issued a decree to rebuild this house of God.

8.11: and of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai and 28 males with him;
8.3: of the sons of Shecaniah [who was] of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah and with him 150 males [who were in] the genealogical list;
8.20: and 220 of the temple servants, whom David and the princes had given for the service of the Levites, all of them designated by name.
8.12: and of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan and 110 males with him;
8.10: and of the sons of Bani, Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah and 160 males with him;
8.17: I sent them to Iddo the leading man at the place Casiphia; and I told them what to say to Iddo [and] his brothers, the temple servants at the place Casiphia, [that is], to bring ministers to us for the house of our God.
8.13: and of the sons of Adonikam, the last ones, these being their names, Eliphelet, Jeuel and Shemaiah, and 60 males with them;
8.27: and 20 gold bowls [worth] 1,000 darics, and two utensils of fine shiny bronze, precious as gold.
8.30: So the priests and the Levites accepted the weighed out silver and gold and the utensils, to bring [them] to Jerusalem to the house of our God.
8.18: According to the good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of insight of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel, namely Sherebiah, and his sons and brothers, 18 men;
8.36: Then they delivered the king's edicts to the king's satraps and to the governors [in the provinces] beyond the River, and they supported the people and the house of God.
8.29: 'Watch and keep [them] until you weigh [them] before the leading priests, the Levites and the heads of the fathers' [households] of Israel at Jerusalem, [in] the chambers of the house of the LORD.'
8.23: So we fasted and sought our God concerning this [matter], and He listened to our entreaty.
8.19: and Hashabiah and Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, with his brothers and their sons, 20 men;
8.1: Now these are the heads of their fathers' [households] and the genealogical enrollment of those who went up with me from Babylon in the reign of King Artaxerxes:
8.5: of the sons of Zattu, Shecaniah, the son of Jahaziel and 300 males with him;
8.4: of the sons of Pahath-moab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah and 200 males with him;
8.8: and of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael and 80 males with him;
8.26: Thus I weighed into their hands 650 talents of silver, and silver utensils [worth] 100 talents, [and] 100 gold talents,
8.14: and of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud, and 70 males with them.
8.22: For I was ashamed to request from the king troops and horsemen to protect us from the enemy on the way, because we had said to the king, 'The hand of our God is favorably disposed to all those who seek Him, but His power and His anger are against all those who forsake Him.'
8.28: Then I said to them, 'You are holy to the LORD, and the utensils are holy; and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering to the LORD God of your fathers.
8.25: and I weighed out to them the silver, the gold and the utensils, the offering for the house of our God which the king and his counselors and his princes and all Israel present [there] had offered.
8.9: of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel and 218 males with him;
8.33: On the fourth day the silver and the gold and the utensils were weighed out in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest, and with him [was] Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them [were] the Levites, Jozabad the son of Jeshua and Noadiah the son of Binnui.
8.15: Now I assembled them at the river that runs to Ahava, where we camped for three days; and when I observed the people and the priests, I did not find any Levites there.
8.34: Everything [was] numbered and weighed, and all the weight was recorded at that time.
8.21: Then I proclaimed a fast there at the river of Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God to seek from Him a safe journey for us, our little ones, and all our possessions.
8.24: Then I set apart twelve of the leading priests, Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and with them ten of their brothers;
8.16: So I sent for Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah and Meshullam, leading men, and for Joiarib and Elnathan, teachers.
8.35: The exiles who had come from the captivity offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel: 12 bulls for all Israel, 96 rams, 77 lambs, 12 male goats for a sin offering, all as a burnt offering to the LORD.
8.32: Thus we came to Jerusalem and remained there three days.
8.7: and of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah and 70 males with him;
8.2: of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush;
8.6: and of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan and 50 males with him;
8.31: Then we journeyed from the river Ahava on the twelfth of the first month to go to Jerusalem; and the hand of our God was over us, and He delivered us from the hand of the enemy and the ambushes by the way.
